description.value: A CodeSystem to identify the category of a condition.
A CodeSystem to identify the episodicity of a condition.

definition.value: The first episode of a condition.
A new episode of a previously recorded condition.
A review of an existing condition episode.
A flare-up of an existing condition episode.
Marks the end of an existing condition episode.

description.value: A CodeSystem that identifies the kind of relationship that exists with a target condition.

definition.value: This condition is combined/merged with the target condition to form a single logical condition.
This condition is part of a group that includes the target condition as a member of the group.
This condition replaces a previous condition (i.e. a revised diagnosis). The target condition is now obsolete.
This condition has evolved from the target condition.
This condition follows-on from the target onset condition. Used when specifing a relationship to a previous onset condition when this condition episodicity is Review, Flare or End.

description.value: A CodeSystem to identify the ethnicity of a Person, as specified by the Person. This vocabulary describes a persons ethnic category, it is an extension of the Ethnic Category Code described in the NHS Data Model and Dictionary.

display.value: All republics which made up the former USSR
Other republics which made up the former Yugoslavia
Other white European, European unspecified, European mixed

description.value: A CodeSystem that identifies the language used by a person.

display.value: Church Slavic; Old Slavonic; Church Slavonic; Old Bulgarian; Old Church Slavonic

description.value: A CodeSystem that identifies the mode the patient can communicate in, representing the method of expression of the language.

A CodeSystem to identify detail codes for flagged medication issues.

name.value: Care Connect NHS Number Verification Status

description.value: A CodeSystem that identifies the trace status of the NHS number. This CodeSystem is comprised of codes from the NHS Data Model and Dictionary: NHS Number Status Indicator Code.

display.value: Trace attempted - No match or multiple match found
Trace needs to be resolved - (NHS number or patient detail conflict)
Number not present and trace not required
Trace postponed (baby under six weeks old)

A code from the SNOMED Clinical Terminology UK coding system that describes an encounter between a care professional and the patient (or patient's record). The patient may be represented by a third party such as a carer or family member. Any code from the SNOMED CT UK 'CDA Encounter Type' subset with subset original id 1341000000130; the corresponding SNOMED CT UK Refset fully specified name is 'Clinical document architecture encounter type simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)' with Refset Id 999000351000000101.

description.value: A codesystem to describe the event that triggered the message.
A codesystem to describe the priority that processing of the payload should be given by the recipient

definition.value: The request has normal priority
The request should be actioned promptly - higher priority than routine
The request should be actioned as soon as possible - higher priority than urgent
The request should be actioned immediately - highest possible priority. E.g. an emergency

description.value: A codesystem to describe if the recipient has been sent the payload for action or for information.

definition.value: The recipient has been sent the payload for action. The action required by the recipient will be either explicit in the payload or there will be a business rule defined.
No Action is required by the recipient and they may process the payload as they see fit.

purpose.value: Code system used to indicate how the Opt-out record was captured.
Code system used to indicate the role of a proxy

name.value: NHS Data Dictionary Main Specialty Code

description.value: A unique code identifying each main specialty designated by Royal Colleges. This is the same as the NHS OCCUPATION CODES describing specialties. This CodeSystem is comprised of codes from the NHS Data Model and Dictionary: Main Specialty Code.

copyright.value: Copyright © 2017 Health and Social Care Information Centre. NHS Digital is the trading name of the Health and Social Care Information Centre.

display.value: RESPIRATORY MEDICINE (also known as thoracic medicine)

description.value: An indicator to identify the legal marital status of a Person.

display.value: Divorced/Person whose Civil Partnership has been dissolved

name.value: NHS Data Model and Dictionary Person Stated Gender Code

description.value: The gender of a Person. Person Stated Gender Code is self declared or inferred by observation for those unable to declare their Person Stated Gender.

display.value: Indeterminate (unable to be classified as either male or female)

description.value: This code system is used to capture the record retrieval mode.

purpose.value: This code system is defined to be bound to the PEC Exemption Type listed.

copyright.value: Copyright © 2017 Health and Social Care Information Centre. NHS Digital is the trading name of the Health and Social Care Information Centre.

display.value: is under 16 years of age - confirmed by source
is 16, 17 or 18 and in full-time education - confirmed by source
is 60 years of age or over - confirmed by source
has a valid maternity exemption certificate - confirmed by source
has a valid medical exemption certificate - confirmed by source
has a valid prescription pre-payment certificate - confirmed by source
has a War Pension exemption certificate - confirmed by source
is named on a current HC2 charges certificate - confirmed by source
gets income support (IS) - confirmed by source
gets income based Job Seeker's Allowance (JSA (IB)) - confirmed by source
is entitled to, or named on a VALID NHS tax credit exemption certificate - confirmed by source
has a partner who gets Pension Credit Guarantee Credit (PCGC) - confirmed by source
Patient does not need to pay the prescription charge - confirmed by source
Not able to confirm exemption from source

description.value: A code system that enumerates a relationship between one person and another. These relationships are not necessarily mutually exclusive, for example a wife may be her husband's next of kin.

purpose.value: This code system is defined to show a a relationship between one person and another.

copyright.value: Copyright © 2017 Health and Social Care Information Centre. NHS Digital is the trading name of the Health and Social Care Information Centre.

definition.value: Other than a parent

display.value: Non-relative lived with for at least 5 years

description.value: A CodeSystem that identifies the Spine error or warning code in response to a request.

display.value: An input field has an invalid value for its type
Conflicting values have been specified in different fields
Request does not match authorisation token
Patient has not provided consent to share data
Organisation has not provided consent to share data
No legitimate relationship exists with this patient
The request exists but is not in an appropriate state for the call to succeed
The type of request is not supported by the API call
Access has been denied to process this request
The sender or receiver's ASID is not authorised for this interaction
There is a required header missing or invalid
SSL Protocol or Cipher requirements not met
Client is not permitted to assign an id
Create would lead to creation of a duplicate resource

description.value: This ValueSet combines four SNOMED CT UK Refsets to allow selection of a code from the SNOMED Clinical Terminology UK coding system. It includes a Refset that describes capability and support required in order to provide accessibility, with regard to disability. This incorporates any code from the SNOMED CT UK 'Accessible information - communication support' subset with subset original id 58921000000137; the corresponding SNOMED CT UK Refset fully specified name is 'Accessible information - communication support simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)' with Refset id 999002121000000109. It also includes a Refset that describes requirements for specific information formats in order to provide accessibility, with regard to disability. This incorporates any code from the SNOMED CT UK 'Accessible Information - requires specific information format' subset with subset original id 58941000000130; the corresponding SNOMED CT UK Refset fully specified name is 'Accessible information - requires specific information format simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)' with Refset id 999002141000000102. It also includes a Refset that describes requirements for a communication professional to be present in order to enable accessibility, with regard to disability. This incorporates any code from the SNOMED CT UK 'Accessible Information - requires communication professional' subset with subset original id 58951000000133; the corresponding SNOMED CT UK Refset fully specified name is 'Accessible information - requires communication professional simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)' with Refset id 999002151000000104. It additionally includes a Refset that describes requirements for specifying contact methods in order to provide accessibility, with regard to disability. This incorporates any code from the SNOMED CT UK 'Accessible Information - requires specific contact method' subset with subset original id 58931000000135; the corresponding SNOMED CT UK Refset fully specified name is 'Accessible information - requires specific contact method simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)' with Refset id 999002131000000106

copyright.value: This value set includes content from SNOMED CT, which is copyright © 2002+ International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO), and distributed by agreement between IHTSDO and HL7. Implementer use of SNOMED CT is not covered by this agreement

display.value: Has ADRT (advance decision to refuse treatment) (Mental Capacity Act 2005)
Has ADRT (advance decision to refuse treatment) for life sustaining treatment (Mental Capacity Act 2005)
Has involved healthcare professional in discussion about ADRT (advance decision to refuse treatment) (Mental Capacity Act 2005)

description.value: This ValueSet combines two SNOMED CT UK Refsets to allow selection of a code from the SNOMED Clinical Terminology UK coding system that describes an Adverse Reaction Propensity or an Allergy Reaction. This incorporates any code from the SNOMED CT UK 'Adverse Reaction propensity' subset with subset original id 1011000000131; the corresponding SNOMED CT UK Refset fully specified name is 'Adverse reaction propensity simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)' with Refset Id 999000261000000107. This also incorporates any code from the SNOMED CT UK 'Allergy Propensity' subset with subset original id 1101000000130; the corresponding SNOMED CT UK Refset fully specified name is 'Allergy propensity simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)' with Refset Id 999000291000000101.

copyright.value: This value set includes content from SNOMED CT, which is copyright © 2002+ International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO), and distributed by agreement between IHTSDO and HL7. Implementer use of SNOMED CT is not covered by this agreement

display.value: Patient known here. (e.g. Patient is registered here)
Patient not known here. (aka ‘patient record not present in system’)
Patient no longer at this clinical setting

description.value: A code from the SNOMED Clinical Terminology UK coding system which is part of a subset of SNOMED-CT intended for use in the UK; a set of codes which represent different aspects of personal emotional wellbeing, including mood, behaviour and impaired cognitive functioning. Any code from the SNOMED CT UK 'Cognition' subset with subset original id 7761000000139; the corresponding SNOMED CT UK Refset fully specified name is 'Cognition finding simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)' with Refset id 999001481000000105.

copyright.value: This value set includes content from SNOMED CT, which is copyright © 2002+ International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO), and distributed by agreement between IHTSDO and HL7. Implementer use of SNOMED CT is not covered by this agreement

description.value: A code from the SNOMED Clinical Terminology UK coding system which contains concepts related to family history of the subject of the record. These are mainly pre-coordinated concepts relating to the medical history of the close family, which may include partners where it may impact the subject's health. Any code from the SNOMED CT UK 'Family History' subset with subset original id 1331000000135; the corresponding SNOMED CT UK Refset fully specified name is 'Family history simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)' with Refset id 999000771000000106.

copyright.value: This value set includes content from SNOMED CT, which is copyright © 2002+ International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO), and distributed by agreement between IHTSDO and HL7. Implementer use of SNOMED CT is not covered by this agreement

display.value: Consent given by appointed person with lasting power of attorney for personal welfare for sharing end of life care coordination record

description.value: A valueset to describe the event that triggered the message.

This ValueSet combines two SNOMED CT UK Refsets to allow selection of a code from the SNOMED Clinical Terminology UK coding system. It includes a Refset that describes any assessment of mobility issues and impacts including mobility in and outside the home, falls and any impact on carers/dependents (recorded with their consent). This incorporates any code from the SNOMED CT UK 'Mobility Issues' subset with subset original id 6001000000138; the corresponding SNOMED CT UK Refset fully specified name is 'Mobility issues simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)' with Refset id 999001551000000100. It also includes a Refset that describes a list of descriptions explaining an individual’s personal physical movement, between two spaces, that achieves participation and a degree of independence. This incorporates any code from the SNOMED CT UK 'Mobility findings' subset with subset original id 69541000000135; the corresponding SNOMED CT UK Refset fully specified name is 'Mobility findings simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)' with Refset id 999002551000000108.

description.value: A code from the SNOMED Clinical Terminology UK coding system which is part of a subset of SNOMED-CT intended for use in the UK; a set of codes which represent Disciplines and Occupations. Any code from the SNOMED CT UK 'Occupation' subset with subset original id 6661000000133; the corresponding SNOMED CT UK Refset fully specified name is 'Occupation simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)' with Refset id 999001571000000109.

description.value: A valueset to indicate the priority that processing of the payload should be given by the recipient
A valueset to describe if the recipient has been sent the payload for action or for information.
The source method that was used to set the preferences
The role performed by the appointed proxy

name.value: NHS Data Dictionary Main Specialty Code 1

description.value: A ValueSet that identifying each main specialty designated by Royal Colleges. This is the same as the NHS OCCUPATION CODES describing specialties.

name.value: NHS Data Model and Dictionary Person Marital Status Code

description.value: An indicator to identify the legal marital status of a Person.

name.value: NHS Data Model and Dictionary Person Stated Gender Code

description.value: The gender of a Person. Person Stated Gender Code is self declared or inferred by observation for those unable to declare their Person Stated Gender.
A ValueSet that identifies the national record locator pointer retrieval mode.
A valueset that describes PEC Exemption Type list.

description.value: A valueset that describes a relationship between one person and another. These relationships are not necessarily mutually exclusive, for example a wife may be her husband's next of kin.

copyright.value: Copyright © 2017 Health and Social Care Information Centre. NHS Digital is the trading name of the Health and Social Care Information Centre.
